doc.previous: It can also be shown that for the underlying B zier curve B  The concept of Degree Elevation can be repeated on a control polygon R to get a sequence of control polygons R R1 R2 and so on After r degree elevations the polygon Rr has the vertices P0 r P1 r P2 r Pn r r given by 12
doc.after: The rational B zier curve adds adjustable weights to provide closer approximations to arbitrary shapes The numerator is a weighted Bernstein form B zier curve and the denominator is a weighted sum of Bernstein polynomials Rational B zier curves can among other uses be used to represent segments of conic sections exactly including circular arcs 13
